header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 14/2019 (Kamlesh Desai etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000164-2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest as a result of complaint dated 06.01.2019 filed by Rajusinh Jogsinh suspecting applicants' involvement in the offence of kidnapping, wrongful confinement, voluntarily causing hurt and extortion etc.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

arguments.text: 3) Advocate for applicants contended that, applicant no.1 had filed Criminal case on 15.06.2018 under Sec. 420, 406 r/w 34 of I.P.C. against the present complainant as he has taken Rs.5,00,000/­ from the applicant no.1 and to avoid its repayment, he filed false case against the present applicants.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Advocate for applicants contended that, applicant no.1 had filed Criminal case on 15.06.2018 under Sec. 420, 406 r/w 34 of I.P.C. against the present complainant as he has taken Rs.5,00,000/­ from the applicant no.1 and to avoid its repayment, he filed false case against the present applicants.

arguments.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on anticipatory bail.
It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime.

arguments.text: 5) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicants, it appears that, applicants for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by A.P.P./I.O. Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicants, it appears that, applicants for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by A.P.P./I.O. Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant no.1 Kamlesh Thanaramji Desai and applicant no.2 Harlal Ganpatram Sigand, they be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Rajusinh Jogsinh dated 06.01.2019 on his furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Fiuve Thousand), each with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicants shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Tuesday and Friday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. b) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall make available themselves and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicants shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicants shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed.

footer: Notice r/o. (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 10th January, 2019 Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 14/2019 (Kamlesh Desai etc.1 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000164-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest as a result of complaint dated 06.01.2019 filed by Rajusinh Jogsinh suspecting applicants' involvement in the offence of kidnapping, wrongful confinement, voluntarily causing hurt and extortion etc. 
---background-ends---
2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4. 
---argument-ends---
3) Advocate for applicants contended that, applicant no.1 had filed Criminal case on 15.06.2018 under Sec. 420, 406 r/w 34 of I.P.C. against the present complainant as he has taken Rs.5,00,000/­ from the applicant no.1 and to avoid its repayment, he filed false case against the present applicants. 
---argument-ends---
4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicants are innocent and assured that, they will neither tamper nor hamper with prosecution witnesses if they are released on anticipatory bail. It is also argued that, applicants having no connection with this alleged offence and they are falsely involved in this crime. 
---argument-ends---
5) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicants, it appears that, applicants for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by A.P.P./I.O. Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant no.1 Kamlesh Thanaramji Desai and applicant no.2 Harlal Ganpatram Sigand, they be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Rajusinh Jogsinh dated 06.01.2019 on his furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Fiuve Thousand), each with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicants shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Tuesday and Friday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. b) Applicants shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicants shall make available themselves and co­ operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicants shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicants shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o. (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 10th January, 2019 Satara
